skills.name: Identify the median from a box plot
Calculate the interquartile range from a box plot
Calculate the range from a box plot
Calculate proportions of total frequency from a box plot

explanations.A: Not quite - I think you've halved the maximum score rather than finding the data point that is halfway through the data set. Remember a box plot is used to display the minimum value, the lower quartile, the median, the upper quartile and the maximum value of the data set. Which of the vertical lines represents the median?
explanations.B: The median value is the vertical line within the box, which is placed at 11.
explanations.C: Not quite, the width of the box is the IQR. The median is the vertical line within the box.
explanations.D: Not quite - you've worked out the range, rather than the median. The median value is represented by the vertical line within the box.

explanations.A: The median is the vertical line within the box, which is placed at 8.
explanations.B: Not quite, the width of the box is the IQR. The median is the vertical line within the box.
explanations.C: Not quite - you've worked out the range, rather than the median. The median value is represented by the vertical line within the box.
explanations.D: Not quite - I think you've halved the maximum score rather than finding the data point that is halfway through the data set. Remember a box plot is used to display the minimum value, the lower quartile, the median, the upper quartile and the maximum value of the data set. Which of the vertical lines represents the median?

explanations.A: Not quite - this is the difference between the maximum and minimum numbers on the scale, which is different to the range of scores. Use the box plot to read off the highest and lowest score then calculate the range.
explanations.B: Not quite, 11 is the median. Remember the range will be the difference between the highest and the lowest score.
explanations.C: Not quite, this is the IQR. The range is the difference between the highest and the lowest score.
explanations.D: From the box plot we can see that the highest score was 16 and the lowest score was 3. Therefore the range of the scores is 16 – 3 = 13

explanations.A: Not quite, 8 is the median. Remember the range will be the difference between the highest and the lowest score.
explanations.B: Not quite, this is the IQR. The range is the difference between the highest and the lowest score.
explanations.C: From the box plot we can see that the highest score was 13 and the lowest score was 0. Therefore the range of the scores is 13 – 0 = 13
explanations.D: Not quite - this is the difference between the maximum and minimum numbers on the scale, which is different to the range of scores. Use the box plot to read off the highest and lowest score then calculate the range.

explanations.A: Not quite - you've found the difference between the maximum and minimum numbers on the scale, but that is different to the interquartile range (IQR) of the box plot. The IQR is the difference between the upper quartile and the lower quartile.
explanations.B: Not quite, 11 is the median. Remember the interquartile range will be the difference between the upper quartile and the lower quartile.
explanations.C: From the box plot we can see that the upper quartile is 13 and the lower quartile is 8. Therefore the interquartile range is 13 - 8 which equals 5.
explanations.D: Not quite, this is the range. The interquartile range will be the difference between the upper quartile and the lower quartile.

explanations.A: Not quite, 8 is the median. Remember the interquartile range will be the difference between the upper quartile and the lower quartile.
explanations.B: From the box plot we can see that the upper quartile is 10 and the lower quartile is 5. Therefore the interquartile range is 10 - 5 which equals 5.
explanations.C: Not quite, this is the range. The interquartile range will be the difference between the upper quartile and the lower quartile.
explanations.D: Not quite - you've found the difference between the maximum and minimum numbers on the scale, but that is different to the interquartile range (IQR) of the box plot. The IQR is the difference between the upper quartile and the lower quartile.

explanations.A: Not quite - this is the maximum number on the scale, not the number of students.
explanations.B: Not quite - this is the maximum score, not the number of students.
explanations.C: Not quite - I think you may have counted the number of vertical lines, but these do not represent the score of each student.
explanations.D: It is impossible to tell how many students took the quiz. A box plot gives us a summary of the distribution of the data, not how many students took part.

explanations.A: Not quite - I think you may have counted the number of vertical lines, but these do not represent the score of each student.
explanations.B: Not quite - this is the maximum number on the scale, not the number of students.
explanations.C: Not quite - this is the maximum score, not the number of students.
explanations.D: It is impossible to tell how many students took the quiz. A box plot gives us a summary of the distribution of the data, not how many students took part.

explanations.A: The upper quartile is 13 and the maximum mark is 16, so we know that 25% or ¼ of students got marks in this range.
explanations.B: Not quite - I think you have divided the range of scores by the total range. 13 marks is the upper quartile. At what fraction or percentage does this lie in a data set?
explanations.C: Not quite - I think you have divided the range of scores by the range of the scale. 13 marks is the upper quartile. At what fraction or percentage does this lie in a data set?
explanations.D: 13 marks is the upper quartile. At what fraction or percentage does this lie in a data set?

explanations.A: Not quite - I think you have divided the range of scores by the range of the scale. 8 marks is the median. At what fraction or percentage does this lie in a data set?
explanations.B: The median is 8 and the maximum mark is 13, so we know that 50% or ½ of students got marks in this range.
explanations.C: Not quite - I think you have divided the range of scores by the total range. 8 marks is the median. At what fraction or percentage does this lie in a data set?
explanations.D: 8 marks is the median. At what fraction or percentage does this lie in a data set?
